Reviews.Title: “Too much for a sleep...”
Reviews.Author: Nimuh
Reviews.Content: Price are too high for an overnight stay... You wont get what you've paid for... Poor service... No wifi, you need to pay $10/day for a wifi access... Not that comfortable... Not suitable for families with kids although it is safe... Not recommended for second visit..

Reviews.Title: “Just for sleep”
Reviews.Author: affarrell
Reviews.Content: suitable for backpackers / travelers who just want to sleep and want a privacy toilet bedroom smelling cigarettes even though non-smoking room. 10 minute walking distance to aljunied mrt station on the way to the mrt station at night, you will go through areas infested with foreign workers hanging out, but nobody will bother you Geylang area is not as clean as the other Singapore Hotel 81 Gold located next to Fragrance ruby hotel and hotel 81 lucky.

Reviews.Title: “good place for the budget traveler”
Reviews.Author: swiswach
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for the Ritz Carlton, this ain't it. However, if you want a low cost, clean, safe place to stay near the MRT (subway), this is it. I stayed here for 5 days. The staff was friendly, professional and the hotel was very nice and clean. I had a room big enough for two small beds and the air conditioner worked great. Bathroom was nicely remodeled. Hotel Gold is located within 5 minutes of subway and lots of places to eat. It is in so called "red light" district, but I didn't see any problem. If there were prostitutes around, they ignored me. Located in very busy shopping district. I will stay here again when I return to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for - typical budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: b79pl
Reviews.Content: It's one of the cheapest hotels in Singapore and considering the price has a good location. It's not that far from the city centre by MRT which is ten minutes by foot from the hotel. There are numerous food corners in the area where you can eat a tasty dinner for S$4. Well, it's Geylang - a bustling and lively neighborhood which streets are alive almost 24 hours a day. It's a red light district but you shouldn't be afraid - it's very safe at any time of day or night, much more safer than any big US/European city even in the bright day. The only reason you might want avoid this area is if you are offended seeing working girls (or for the same reason - if you're traveling with children). The room is very small, not much space besides bed. No fridge which is a big disadvantage considering temperatures (I mean the aircon is very efficient so it's not like there's hot in the room - but you really enjoy a cold drink in Singapore at any the of day and night)! Well, this is a budget hotel and one of the cheapest in Singapore - you can't have high expectations. Don't push the lock button from the inside if you're leaving the room (what is a common practice in many hotel locks) - if you push it you won't be able to open the door from outside, it's mean to use from inside only. The reception staff is very nice and helpful though and they send someone within two minutes after I reported a problem with getting to my room - the man who came had master key and simply opened the door for me. Even if the hotel is a budget one, the service is good and the room is cleaned well and fresh towels delivered during your stay (not that obvious standard in very cheap hotels).

Reviews.Title: “Good for backpackers”
Reviews.Author: mooordek
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel 81 for 2 nights. Hotel is located in famous district Geylang which has a bad opinions but I was feeling safe. Around hotel there is many local restaurants with tasty food. 5 minutes to MRT. About hotel: I had room at 5th floor (there was elevator), rooms was small, tv, bathroom with full equipment, air-conditioning (we can't turned off and staff too so a-c worked all time during our stay - sometimes was very cold in room). Generally I recommend for young little requiring persons.

Reviews.Title: “Small and simple room”
Reviews.Author: papaija2008
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights here a week ago. The room was quite clean but very small with no extra space for luggage. Also the bathroom/toilet was small and there wasn't socket for ie. electric razor. The hotel is located on a street where prostitutes hang out. I was left alone even though I was alone, but if you're disturbed just by the fact that the prostitutes are there, this hotel (and area in general) is not for you. Aljunied MRT station is about 10 mins. walk away and there's lots of restaurants nearby. The conclusion is tha it's an OK hotel for short stay for solo traveller.

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: AiiniiAli
Reviews.Content: i go with my buddies at 11/5/2011 and stay there for 3 nite and they charge us SGD200. for us it was cheap. the room was clean also the toilet. got a lcd tv attach to the wall. but the place for us is quite scarry coz its located at Geylang (hooker place). the hooker already standing along the road and in front the hotel waiting for the customer. so, we afraid to go out at nite. thx god, as long as we stay there, we did not occur any trouble.

Reviews.Title: “We will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: popallan
Reviews.Content: This hotel must be one of the cheapest, only SGD60 per night. Hostel may be cheaper but we prefer private room with inside toilet. Extremely helpful staff, they called for taxi too. Rooms are small but it’s okay for couples. Beds have pvc plastic mattress and are old but comfortable. Reminder: bring your own pillowcase you will need it. Bathroom is very small and can be a problem for overweighed people. The room had everything we wanted for a good stay. Free coffee, ginger tea and a bottle of water daily. Flat screen TV with movie and sports channels. Air con worked very well and was one of these with degree control on the wall so it was no problem to regulate. Windows can’t be open and I think this is for safety reason. Our room was cleaned daily what more do you need! Great location; Aljunied MRT Station (EW9) is 10 minutes away on foot and there is a 7 Eleven store on the main street about 100 meters from the hotel and many food places.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: rosecol11
Reviews.Content: Not sure what to expect due to the area, but no problems. Hotel is clean and the staff friendly and helpful, the room was small but it's what we expected, we left a suitcase at airport as only here for 2 nights, plenty of places to eat locally and buses close by.

Reviews.Title: “Basic budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: DenimSneakers
Reviews.Content: Me, my wife and my sister have stayed in this hotel for a quick trip to Singapore. As we only stayed in hotel for sleep, it was a good deal for us (It's not a secret that hotel rate in Singapore is pricey). Room is basic and its cleanliness is moderate. Located in red-light district made us a little worry at first, but this is Singapore, one of the safest city in the world. We leave early in the morning and came back at night and couple times saw a group of escort ladies near the hotel, but it's not a problem at all. They won't disturb you when you act and walk normally. The hotel is only 10 mnts from MRT station so it's very easy to go everywhere. It's also quite near to city center and taxi will only cost you around SGD 8-10. If your time in Singapore will be spend outside hotel for sightseeing, shopping, etc, then this hotel would save lots of your budget.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: bucksie
Reviews.Content: The rooms suited our purposes as we were only transiting Singapore and didnt want to pay the higher price of Changi transit hotels. The rooms are small and dark and there is an integrated shower/toilet arrangement . If you are used to 5 star type accomodation, then this is not the place for you either, and due the cramped quarters, may not suit a 3+ day stay. We found staff were friendly, helpful and polite. We stayed here also on the return sector of our trip from Veitnam. Rooms can be hired on a per hour basis, handy for transit travellers like us. Although this is the red light district, prostiutes that use this hotel and in the area are quite friendly and polite, I suspect its because of the zero tolerance/death penalty on drug use. At all times we felt safe. ..

Reviews.Title: “Poor quality in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Olenka_11
Reviews.Content: We have chosen the hotel because of its budget price and perfect location. As we were planning to move around the city using MRT, sighed with relief when the closeness to the MRT confirmed. It took us maximum 10-minutes walk to the station and only about 25 minutes to get to the hotel from the airport. The room was really very tiny and could place only two of us, suitcase and there was some place left to make minimum of movement. But this fact as well as location in the red lights district were easily ignored because we were exploring the city from early in the morning till late at night. The worst thing was fungus on the ceiling. It smelled hard enough to erase the cough that disturbed us at night. In the morning we were promised to being changed the room but in fact it appeared that the guy had forgotten his promise. As a consumption can tell that if you know that you're allergic or just sensitive to smells and other irritants better choose something more expensive. It's not the thing that can be ignored or easily forgotten.

Reviews.Title: “unaccommodating male front desk”
Reviews.Author: iwanttotravelforfree
Reviews.Content: the room is near the main road and bus stop. toiletries are included

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel 81 - Gold
HotelInfo.Address: 20 Lorong 20 Geylang, Singapore 398738, Singapore
